name: Forest Emperor
movement: walk 30 ft., climb 30 ft., fly 60 ft.
description: The Forest Emperor is a large aberration with a grotesque appearance, possessing acidic claws and a long tail. Its flower-ringed eye pits give it a distinct look, and it constantly rattles its tail, creating an ominous presence.
memorable: Its ability to drain hit points from enemies permanently and impose fear makes the Forest Emperor a truly terrifying creature.
goals: To dominate its environment and instill fear in others, assert its control, and eliminate threats.
relations: Related to other aberrant creatures and may command lesser aberrations or terrorize forest animals.
environment: Typically found in forested areas, where it can effectively utilize its camouflage abilities.
strengths: High durability due to a large pool of hit points and resistances to acid and cold, strong physical attacks.
weaknesses: Low Charisma leads to difficulties in social interactions.
attacks: Multiattack with claw and tail strikes, dealing significant slashing, acid, and bludgeoning damage.
most_powerful_ability: Toxic Nectar Spray, an area attack dealing heavy acid damage in a wide cone.
senses: Possesses keen smell, gaining advantage on perception checks reliant on smell.
skills: Excellent perception allows it to detect hidden creatures effectively.
additional_information: Immunities to acid and cold damage
Can frighten nearby creatures with its tail rattle
Regenerates health from drained hit points
Advantage on stealth checks in forest terrain
test_queries: huge aberration that drains hit points
creature that frightens foes in forests
acidic claw attacks and fear abilities
mobile forest predator with toxic spray
